article.heading: Banks, Banking Businesses, Trust Companies and Savings and Loan Associations

section.heading: National banking associations and state banks; tax imposed; rate of tax

content.p: 79-1107. National banking associations and state banks; tax imposed; rate of tax. (a) Every national banking association and state bank located or doing business within the state shall pay to the state for the privilege of doing business within the state a tax according to or measured by its net income for the next preceding taxable year to be computed as provided in this act. Such tax shall consist of a normal tax and a surtax and shall be computed as follows: (1) For tax year 2024, and all tax years thereafter, the normal tax shall be an amount equal to 1.94% of such net income; and (2) the surtax shall be an amount equal to 2.125% of such net income in excess of $25,000. (b) The tax levied shall be in lieu of ad valorem taxes which might otherwise be imposed by the state or political subdivisions thereof upon shares of capital stock or the intangible assets of national banking associations and state banks.
